resources/setup-git.title: Getting Started with Git
resources/setup-git.content:
Getting Started with Git
Git is the most popular version control system. Hereâ€™s how to get started:
Installation
brew install git
Basic Configuration
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "you@example.com"
Common Commands

git init â€” Initialize a new repository
git clone <url> â€” Clone a repository
git add . â€” Stage changes
git commit -m "message" â€” Commit changes
git push â€” Push to remote

Further Reading

Pro Git Book
GitHub Docs

resources/setup-nvim.title: Setting Up Neovim for Development
resources/setup-nvim.content:
Setting Up Neovim for Development
Neovim is a powerful, extensible text editor. Hereâ€™s a basic setup:
Installation
brew install neovim
Basic Configuration
Create or edit ~/.config/nvim/init.vim:
set number
syntax on
set tabstop=4
set shiftwidth=4
set expandtab
Plugins
Use vim-plug:
call plug#begin('~/.vim/plugged')
Plug 'preservim/nerdtree'
Plug 'junegunn/fzf'
Plug 'neoclide/coc.nvim', {'branch': 'release'}
call plug#end()
Further Reading

Neovim Docs
Awesome Neovim

resources/setup-shell.title: Customizing Your Shell
resources/setup-shell.content:
Customizing Your Shell
A productive shell can boost your workflow.
Popular Shells

Bash
Zsh
Fish

Customization Tips

Use a theme (e.g., Oh My Zsh)
Add useful plugins (autosuggestions, syntax highlighting)
Customize your prompt

Example: Oh My Zsh
sh -c "$(curl -fsSL raw.githubusercontent.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh)"
Further Reading

Oh My Zsh
Awesome Zsh Plugins
